subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: new font released
msgSnippet: ... Thanks. That helps. Apparently I had forgotten to paste in these glyphs at all. Now they are pasted in. You can download the font on the files section and
messageBody:
jeff_smith_8992 wrote:
>
>
> Paul,
>
> I think the missing mappings are these:
>
> Ian - should be mapped to the "W" key (upper case "w").
> Earth - should be mapped to the "x" key (lower case "x").
>
> These are the key mappings for Jon Zuck's entire symbol list, except
> for the last 4 "special" mappings, in the order he shows them in
> "Revised Shaw Alphabet of Kingsley Read":
>
> p t k f T s S c j h
> b d g v H z Z J w `
> N n a i e A y o Y U
> m l r I E F Q q O M
> W C X x R P V
>
> If you just paste these into a word processor, select all of them, and
> then convert to "Thoth" font, you should see which symbols are missing.

Thanks. That helps. Apparently I had forgotten to paste in these glyphs
at all. Now they are pasted in. You can download the font on the files
section and test it out.

There are not slots in the Unicode area for these ligatures, correct?
Really, I would like to cheat and put the ligatures in the Unicode font.
Technically speaking, ligatures should not go into Unicode; instead,
they should be handles by the so called rendering level, meaning that
when one types in "Ah" and then "Roar," the program should replace them
with "Are." But if I make my font that way, it makes it impossible to
sometimes use "Are," and sometimes use "Ah" + "Roar."

I guess that should be its own thread.

Paul
